results.title: Drive
results.brief_description: ‘Drive’ takes the watcher on a drive through the bright lights and dark corners of a big city. The animation uses a combination of 3D animation and line drawing to surreal effect giving the work a dreamlike quality - not unlike the experience of driving through the city at night.

results.title: Adventure has wings
results.creator_credit: Anthony Clay and Royal Society for the Protection of Birds
results.brief_description: Shows the variety of birds in Britain in different situations as seen by two town children, two country children, and their friends. How the RSPB’s Young Ornithologist’s Club makes birdwatching more enjoyable more adventurous. Designed for showing to children aged 9-13 years to increase their interest in birds and birdwatching.

results.title: The Adventure
results.brief_description: Describes a little boy’s adventurous train ride, while his mother frantically searches for him. The little boy falls asleep after the initial excitement of the ride is dispelled, and awakens to find the train in a railway yard, and is scared by the alien and bewildering surrounds. In an endeavour to escape he rushes blindly into the arms of a friendly railway worker who calms his fear and re-unites him with his mother. Written by John Richardson and stars Stephen Paul as the boy and Ethel Paul as his mother.

results.title: The Advancing flame
results.creator_credit: Derek Stewart Productions and British Petroleum
results.brief_description: Shows a cross section of heavy and light industries where oil fuel is used to advantage in the United Kingdom, Germany, Holland, Sweden and Switzerland. Research and development to achieve higher efficiencies in modern industries investigates drop size distribution, flame radiation, gas flow in boilers, and high intensity combustion, which may well influence plant design and processes in future.

results.title: Advances in cheddar cheesemaking
results.brief_description: Designed primarily for the cheese industry. Firstly it shows the traditional method of cheesemaking and then it describes a mechanical process developed to reduce the time and labour required.

results.title: Advanced tumbling
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tumbling”.
Designed to aid in the teaching of more difficult stunts, including low arm to arm balance, snap arm to arm balance, high arm to arm balance, backward handspring, round-off to backward handspring, side leg pitch, backward somersault, shoulder straddle into assisted forward somersault, and combinations.

results.title: Teaching english by the situational method: an advanced structure
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, Timothy Read and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the method of teaching an accelerated English course using the situation method. Includes English drilling, concept development and contrastive drills.

results.title: Advanced passenger train
results.brief_description: Gives an insight into British Rail’s Experimental Advanced Passenger Train powered by gas turbines and with a host of revolutionary ideas such as a tilting system to stabilise the train at speed on sharp curves and hydro-kinetic braking.
